poll_list.title: Engineering Resource for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023

discourse_list.title: PECU Seeking Approval to Transfer Engineering Resource to Phoenix Labs

content.content: PECU Seeking Approval to Transfer Engineering Resource to Phoenix Labs In advance of today’s G&R call where Phoenix Labs will be discussed, PECU is seeking approval from Governance to dedicate one engineer to the Phoenix Labs initiative for a limited time. Please read the below for context and background. PECU recognises the importance of growth through innovation and that the Spark Protocol via Phoenix Labs could be in a position to help future SubDAOs scale. This initiative seeks to draw innovation to the periphery of Maker, vs the stable core-code upon which Maker is based. The recent Spark Protocol MIPs have failed to seek approval from Governance to commence or dedicate technical resource to this initiative prior to the formal MIP passing. PECU is proposing the following to remedy the confusion and provide transparency for work that is happening now. PECU is requesting that the following resources be formally dedicated to Phoenix Labs:  1 full-time engineer (@hexonaut)  Funding will only be provided for February, March, and April. This is done under the assumption that a new PECU budget cycle and business entity will be sought from May 2023. At this point in time, Phoenix Labs and its technical team will have had sufficient runway to pursue their next steps independently. This request for 1 engineer to formally work for Phoenix Labs is being posted in parallel with this poll request (the team’s code review of Spark Lend D3M implementation). Similarly, we hope  that a governance poll will be suitable for approval.
content.GPT-summary: PECU is proposing to dedicate one engineer to the Phoenix Labs initiative for a limited time. The proposal seeks to draw innovation to the periphery of Maker, and PECU is requesting that the following resources be formally dedicated to Phoenix Labs: 1 full-time engineer (@hexonaut). The post also mentions that the recent Spark Protocol MIPs have failed to seek approval from Governance to commence or dedicate technical resource to this initiative prior to the formal MIP passing.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I guess, here it is needed to also share what would be impact of such decision on current project: Which PECU project will get impacted and what is the estimated delay on it. I guess finding a resource cover Sam’s skillset is not in the plan, so 3 months of Sam will equate to more then 3 months delay in X project.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Although obviously I won’t be able to keep at my previous Maker Core workload, I’ll probably continue working 6-7 days a week and splitting my time as there is still lots of active work for Maker Core and the team is stretched pretty thin these days. There is also some overlap for example dog-fooding the Omnibus spell and preparing to scale the executive vote horizontally. It’s helpful to have someone on the outside who knows the system.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I think it speaks highly of you to offer this. But launching a protocol is no joke and the SparkLend team is small. I’d expect that to be a more than full time commitment to give it the best chance of success.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
